page.title: 18Natural History.
page.content: The London Borough of Sutton Community Programme is to restore the natural line of the River Wandle and its botany.Work began in early 1984. About twelve years ago the river was wider so the rubbish flowed along easily. However at Dale Park Bend, the flow slowed down and rubbish started to collect, causing a terrible smell. The Water Board received complaints and decided to narrow the river so that it would flow faster and keep cleaner. Ecologists have complained that certain plants no longer grow, so the river should be widened! Plans to transform the Wandle into a community and leisure area have gradually been put together. A wildlifesanctury and a National Trust area are adjacent to the River Wandle near to Mitcham.
